snippet: The 30-minute video was the first to be released by the militant group, Ansar Beit al-Maqdis, since publicly declaring its affiliation on Monday with the Islamic State.
abstract: Ansar Beit al-Maqdis, lethal jihadist group in Egypt, releases video that appears to show its militants attacking and killing more than 31 soldiers in the Sinai Peninsula in October; video is first to be released by group since they publicly declared affiliation with the Islamic State.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MERNA THOMAS

lead_paragraph: The 30-minute video was the first to be released by the militant group, Ansar Beit al-Maqdis, since publicly declaring its affiliation on Monday with the Islamic State.

headline.main: In Egypt, Jihadists Release Video of an October Attack
headline.print_headline: In Egypt, Jihadists Release Video of an October Attack

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
